    • Trying Japanese food: (Okonomiyaki)

       Posted on July 02, 2012 by David Mohl

      Okonomiyaki is often called a “Japanese pancake”. For me it wasn’t a pancake at all. More a… strange mix… of everything you want. Put it together, mix it with egg and cabbage and there you go - okonomiyaki!

    • Tokyo Tower!

       Posted on June 28, 2012 by David Mohl

      Costs around 800 yen to go up. It’s splitted into “Main Observatory” and the “Special Observatory” which costs around 600 yen extra.

      The Main Observatory is located at 150m height, the Special Observatory at 250m. Sadly we were too late for the special one so only Main Observatory this time.

      ...

    • Over to Kamakura

       Posted on June 25, 2012 by David Mohl

      Kamakura is a city, around 50km away from Tokyo. Right at the ocean. We went there by riding the Shonan-Shinjuku line from Shibuya to Zushi, leaving the train at Kamakura station. Costs around 900 yen.

      There is also the “Daibutsu”, 大仏 or “Great Buddha” inside Kōtoku-in. A big bronze buddha...
